description:
When nova-compute starts up, it loops around waiting for nova-conductor to respond before it proceeds with its startup process.  If nova-conductor doesn't respond to a ping request, it results in an exception in the log.  This is an expected type of failure that should be handled gracefully and not make a mess in the log.  Here is an example:

http://logs.openstack.org/22610/2/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/6278/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz
title: nova-compute logging exception when waiting on nova-conductor to start

comments.content:
When nova-compute starts up, it loops around waiting for nova-conductor to respond before it proceeds with its startup process.  If nova-conductor doesn't respond to a ping request, it results in an exception in the log.  This is an expected type of failure that should be handled gracefully and not make a mess in the log.  Here is an example:

http://logs.openstack.org/22610/2/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/6278/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/23295
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: Also affects oslo  ... I don't think the rpc drivers need to be logging a traceback on a timeout.  They should let the caller decide how to handle the timeout, and whether that should result in a traceback in the log.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

commit 23e9b6e9846237acf89a74fdea50a69528a28ef6
Author: Russell Bryant <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Mar 1 11:40:39 2013 -0500

    Tone down logging while waiting for conductor.
    
    When nova-compute starts, it sits in a loop waiting for nova-conductor
    to be responsive, since it is required for nova-compute to be able to
    complete its startup process.  If a ping request times out, don't leave
    a traceback mess in the log.  This is an expected type of failure that
    is handled.  Just leave it as a warning in case the problem really is
    that nova-conductor hasn't been started.
    
    Fix bug 1137994.
    
    Change-Id: I0754fbd6faf35a09b8733d3ced77871268abf1e8
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/23297
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/386a6fa8c96c1e6be43cc64e51d82a129ba5918f
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 386a6fa8c96c1e6be43cc64e51d82a129ba5918f
Author: Russell Bryant <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Mar 1 11:47:40 2013 -0500

    Don't log a traceback on rpc call timeout.
    
    There are cases where an rpc call is gracefully handled.  The rpc
    drivers should just let the caller deal with this and decide whether it
    is an error worth logging a traceback over.  Otherwise, we unnecessarily
    raise alarm by leaving a mess in the log file.
    
    Fix bug 1137994.
    
    Change-Id: I0e831ddcc43ffea78aae1fb5e46c5037c461b2a1
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

commit 229b815fb72dccf998b18a0ad019cc61ccb888d8
Author: Matthew Sherborne <email address hidden>
Date:   Sun Mar 10 11:06:38 2013 +1000

    Improves Logging for for rpc method timeouts
    
    This patch moves the traceback for an rpc timeout from inside an
    iterator, which gave a useless traceback, into the main flow of the
    program.
    
    It also adds the rpc method being called and the topic used to the
    exception's message.
    
    When the caller logs the message higher up the stack, the log
    information and traceback will be more useful.
    
    Finally it removes the timeout logging in the amqp.py module, in the
    spirit of bug #1137994 and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23295/
    
    Works towards: bug #1148516
    
    Change-Id: I29a3b1b97c6114c4479e2b71c1257c4d72131535
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
